question: 憂い
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, but wait! It's not an adjective, it's just a noun (tricky, tricky). The kanji means <kanji>grief</kanji>, so this word means <vocabulary>grief</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>distress</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned this reading when you learned <ja>憂える</ja>. Remember that and you'll remember this!
